product_description: Highly functional and easy to install drop-in ceiling tiles – EPD + Cradle to Cradle certified
standard_dimensions: 1195 x 595mm to fit T-Frame suspended ceiling systems with a nominal 1200 x 600mm grid
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles are designed for disassembly and reuse, as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures and can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Distance from manufacturing plant to the port of the country of origin is 120km. Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with substrate panel size in mind. The 1195 x 595mm dimensions are designed to fit perfectly into T-Frame suspended ceiling systems with a nominal 1200 x 600mm grid. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic ceiling tiles do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures and can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise end of life disassembly.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: A versatile, heavy-duty crepe upholstery textile made from 100% solid-coloured Australian wool
recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed, mains and recirculated water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Textile weaving and dyeing are carried out in a vertical facility, and the distance from the final manufacturing stage to the port is under 15km, both of which significantly minimise transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Australia due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments: The majority of Instyle LIFE Sustainable Textiles are made locally in Australia or NZ, minimising transport kilometres. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: An acoustic tile made from 100% bio-based materials derived from plants + agricultural waste

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

standard_dimensions: Flat Tile Depth: 40mm, Ellipse Tile Depth: 70mm / Dimensions: 800mm x 400mm
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic SC panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycled_content_description: The hemp fibre component of Bio Tile is composed of a reutilised waste byproduct from hemp processing which has no competing industrial use.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (Polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be chemically reprocessed into new polyester filaments or downcycled into aggregate composite materials (e.g. foam).
compostable_conditions: Bio Tile will biodegrade in the industrial composting process.
reusable_description: Ecoustic Bio Tiles are designed for disassembly and reuse. Our tiles are installed using Instyle's intuitive clip system which is provided with the tile. Ecoustic Infills are completely separable from the tile shell. This system eliminates the need for adhesives and allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic Bio Tiles can be returned to Instyle for recirculating, reprocessing, downcycling or energy recovery through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: No water is used in the production of Ecoustic Bio Tile.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific practices are in place, however attention is paid to optimising logistics routes, consolidating shipments to reduce trips, and the sourcing of raw materials  in the same region as production.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact, and costs can be minimised by carefully considering the tile size in the design process.The modular style of the Bio Tile and its interlocking clip system allow for flexible patterns and orientations. Tile placement should be optimised to match common room dimensions and maximise sound attenuation using the minimum number of tiles required for ideal space acoustics. The Ecoustic design team can provide efficient installation guidance for our Ecoustic products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in biocomposite supply chains, such as poor labour conditions, child labour, and health hazards, can occur at both farming and processing stages. While the location of our raw material sourcing has strict government regulations to safeguard worker rights, Instyle exercises Human Rights Due Diligence by ensuring transparency, ethical sourcing and compliance checks across our supply network.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Recent studies (Lott et al., 2024) on the persistence and toxicity of bioplastics show that the plant-derived polymer used in Bio Tile does not produce persistent microplastic risks. Unlike non-biodegradable fossil fuel-derived polymers, this binder hydrolyses into water-soluble molecules that biodegrade completely, preventing permanent nano- and micro-plastic accumulation in the environment. However, more research is needed to understand other effects of biocomposite breakdown in various ecosystems.
specific_installation_methods: Instyle's intuitive clip system eliminates the need for adhesives and allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Adhesives should not be used to ensure safe and effective biodegradability if the product is broken down in the industrial composting cycle.
other_comments:
2024 GOOD DESIGN AWARD WINNER – https://good-design.org/projects/vank-x-instyle-bio-tile/
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Bio Tile shapes new mindsets towards human-nature relationships in the built environment. It promotes renewable, bio-based resources, minimises synthetics and foregrounds the uniquely climate-beneficial properties of hemp & flax. 
------------------------------------------
Bio Tile’s greatest impact comes from rejecting the use of fossil fuel primary materials in favour of those with low embodied carbon, paving the way for just material transitions. Its utilisation of renewable agricultural waste inputs and design for disassembly integrates circular processes, and its demonstrated sound attenuation and biophilic attributes elevate human comfort and well-being.
-----------------------------------------------
In a fundamental shift towards a resource-efficient cycle, Bio Tile highlights one of the most climate-beneficial industrial fibre crops on the planet: the rapidly CO2-absorbing hemp plant. One hectare of industrial hemp can absorb approximately 15 tonnes of CO2, four times more than young forests, making it a powerful tool in carbon emission reduction. Both hemp and flax are annually renewable, require minimal resources, and do not compete with food production. Combining this resource efficiency with the use of renewable energy for production and the choice of a plant-derived biopolymer for structure demonstrates the kind of best practice manufacturing processes the wider industry can adopt. This data is in the process of being quantified through a Lifecycle Assessment (LCA) and creation of an EPD.
-----------------------------------------------
Bio Tile was developed with the principles of biodesign, which seeks to connect people with nature for improved well-being. Its raw texture and earthy tones reflect the imperfections found in nature; the gentle topography of the Ellipse shape acts as both a diffuser to break up sound waves, and an element of biophilic harmony.
--------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: A marle felt upholstery textile with a soft, luxurious touch made from Australian wool + alpaca
recyclable_percentage_description: The wool component of Instyle's LIFE Textiles is inherently renewable and biodegradable. All pure wool and wool-rich LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/.
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Production facility recycles approx. 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Instyle's countries of manufacture due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments:
The production facility operates with over 80% renewable energy, complies with REACH standards for safety and environmental protection, and recycles approximately 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for textiles uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: A sophisticated, versatile, ADF + PFAS-free high performance indoor + outdoor vinyl
recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Vinyls and HP Textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently no recycling capability for flexible bonded vinyls in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the vinyl and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in PVC furnishing vinyl supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Instyle's manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes vinyls more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, vinyls should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's additive-free formulation for vinyls ensures these products are free from PFAS, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. Additionally, the formulation achieves reduced energy and water consumption and promotes waste recycling through the use of solution-dyed products. This is supported by our manufacturer’s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

standard_dimensions: 12mm thickness (+/-1-2mm), Nominal dimensions: 1100x2700mm (See specification for exact dimensions)
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic V Panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic V Panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic V Panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic V Panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic V Panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Refer to EPD for full breakdown. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: A contemporary wool + alpaca blend textile with a subtle dynamic pattern
recyclable_percentage_description: The wool component of Instyle's LIFE Textiles is inherently renewable and biodegradable. All pure wool and wool-rich LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/.
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Production facility recycles approx. 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Instyle's countries of manufacture due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments:
The production facility operates with over 80% renewable energy, complies with REACH standards for safety and environmental protection, and recycles approximately 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_offcuts_description: Synthetic and High Performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: 100% Olefin fibre is capable of being recycled up to 10 times. However, Australia currently lacks onshore facilities for polypropylene fibre recycling, so end-of-life processing would need to be handled offshore. We are actively supporting initiatives for local recycling solutions that recapture value instead of limiting end-of-life pathways to downcycling to lower grade products.
end_of_life_program_description: Synthetic and High Performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: No water is used in the production of Mezzo yarn, however our manufacturing facility uses recycled water and harvested rainwater to reduce potable water use, recapturing 98% of water. Wastewater is purified and returned to local waterways. Dry treatments and efficient dyeing save over 25 million liters annually.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Extrusion, processing and weaving are carried out in a vertical facility, which significantly minimises transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While synthetic furnishing materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, OEKO–TEX and Zero Discharge of Hazardous Chemicals Program compliant, however Olefin textiles can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
other_comments:
Olefin’s production is exceptionally water-efficient, needing no water for yarn extrusion or dyeing. It is highly durable, with a 100-year life cycle, and features low thermal conductivity, chemical resistance, and natural mold and bacteria resistance.

No fossil fuels are used to heat the manufacturing facility as machine heat is repurposed to warm the building. All waste from yarn extrusion is upcycled into raw materials for the automotive and carpet industries.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: A chrome-free European leather with a beautiful soft handle and appearance

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses a biological Water Treatment Plant, utilising 100% non-potable river water in a closed-loop process that purifies the water before returning it to the source.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. As global leaders in sustainable leather production, our European partner Elmo sets high standards to actively reducing risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, you can visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While synthetic furnishing materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH & STeP by OEKO-TEX compliant, however synthetic textiles can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for textiles uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: An elegant, highly usable + high-performance textile with a timeless texture

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: High-performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently limited recycling capability for bonded and PU-backed textiles in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the textile and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While high-performance textiles offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however high-performance textiles can still release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways for these textiles through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate these potential impacts.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes high-performance textiles more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, these textiles should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's reduced toxicity formulation for high-performance textiles ensures these products are free from PFAS, PFCs, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. This is supported by our manufacturer’s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_percentage_description: 100% polyester textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: 100% polyester textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: 100% polyester is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin polyester. Australia’s commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for 100% polyester textiles are limited; however, Instyle's third-party partners can process this waste, ensuring it is diverted from landfill and repurposed into valuable materials.
end_of_life_program_description: 100% polyester textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Unknown
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Textile weaving is done by LoomTex in Geelong, and the distance from the final manufacturing stage to the port is under 15km, both of which significantly minimise transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the textile and can provide an accurate material requirement. modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. However, these risks are low in Australia due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Polyester textiles can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.

product_description: Ecoustic Raw is a restrained and subtle acoustic panel print emulating hard industrial surfaces

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

standard_dimensions: 8mm* 13.5mm*, 25mm*, 50mm* + Ecoustic Screen 12mm* (*MOQs apply)/Print size: Panel 1200x2700mm, Screen 1200x2400mm appro
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Artwork is screenprinted using non-hazardous , water-based GOTS-certified Permaset inks. These formulations reduce potable water use as they require less water for washing and involve recycling and treating water to minimise fresh water demand. Water is not used in the manufacturing of panel substrate.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

These installation options allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic screens can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic screens are designed for improved dematerialisation and disassembly. Screens can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive, or can simply be dropped into permanent fixtures without adhesive. These installation options allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for textiles uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: A high-performance indoor vinyl with an embossed diamond stitch effect

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Vinyls and HP Textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently no recycling capability for flexible bonded vinyls in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the vinyl and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in PVC furnishing vinyl supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Instyle's manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes vinyls more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, vinyls should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's additive-free formulation for vinyls ensures these products are free from PFAS, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. Additionally, the formulation achieves reduced energy and water consumption and promotes waste recycling through the use of solution-dyed products. This is supported by our manufacturer’s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for textiles uses high percentage recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_description: Highly functional ceiling tiles in multiple colours + thicknesses, to fit new/existing grid systems
standard_dimensions: 12mm / 13.5mm / 24mm / 25mm thickness for 600x600mm or 1200x600mm T-Frame suspended ceiling systems
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles are designed for disassembly and reuse, as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures and can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with substrate panel size in mind. The 1195 x 595mm dimensions are designed to fit perfectly into T-Frame suspended ceiling systems with a nominal 1200 x 600mm grid. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC + Felt products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare, Cradle to Cradle and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic ceiling tiles do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures and can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise end of life disassembly.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic Velour offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. reusable_description: Ecoustic Velour fabric is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyle’s commitment to material efficiency. Unlike our other Ecoustic panels, which can be installed with aluminium and cable hardware to minimise adhesive use, Ecoustic Velour generally requires adhesive-based installation. Please check the terms of Instyle's REVIVE® product stewardship scheme for takeback applicability.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic velour can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ (product must be free of adhesives, hardware and contaminants)
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with roll size in mind. It is advisable to design components in dimensions that maximise the yield of both roll width and length. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products using Ecoustic Velour.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic Velour fabric is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyle’s commitment to material efficiency. Unlike our other Ecoustic panels, which can be installed with aluminium and cable hardware to minimise adhesive use, Ecoustic Velour generally requires adhesive-based installation. Please check the terms of Instyle's REVIVE® product stewardship scheme for takeback applicability. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Refer to EPD for full breakdown. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

product_name: Feel – Acoustic Drapery From Life Sustainable Textiles
product_description: A beautiful, soft, wool + alpaca marle felt textile ideal for softening sound within a space

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: The wool component of Instyle's LIFE Textiles is inherently renewable and biodegradable. All pure wool and wool-rich LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/.
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Production facility recycles approx. 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Instyle's countries of manufacture due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments:
The production facility operates with over 80% renewable energy, complies with REACH standards for safety and environmental protection, and recycles approximately 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic Weave panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic Weave panels can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic Weave panels are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. They can be mounted to a surface using either an aluminium frame system, or a concealed screw and batten system. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic Weave panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with substrate panel size in mind. Refer to the brochure for assembly options, ensure to provide a plan for installation, and contact the Instyle Ecoustic team for CAD drawings.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic Weave panels are designed for easy, quick installation + disassembly, and can be reused as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures. They can be mounted to a surface using either an aluminium frame system, or a concealed screw and batten system. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise end of life disassembly.

water_reduction_techniques: Artwork is screenprinted using non-hazardous , water-based GOTS-certified Permaset inks. These formulations reduce potable water use as they require less water for washing and involve recycling and treating water to minimise fresh water demand. Water is not used in the manufacturing of panel substrate.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: High-performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently limited recycling capability for bonded and PU-backed textiles in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the textile and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While high-performance textiles offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however high-performance textiles can still release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways for these textiles through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate these potential impacts.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes high-performance textiles more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, these textiles should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's reduced toxicity formulation for high-performance textiles ensures these products are free from PFAS, PFCs, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. This is supported by our manufacturer’s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: A an exquisite, sturdy European semi-aniline upholstery leather perfect for public areas

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses a biological Water Treatment Plant, utilising 100% non-potable river water in a closed-loop process that purifies the water before returning it to the source.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. As global leaders in sustainable leather production, our European partner Elmo sets high standards to actively reducing risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
